Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Stipendium, Max Planck Institut für europäische Rechtsgeschichte, Frankfurt am Main
Pre-doctoral short-term residency, Dumbarton Oaks, Harvard, Washington D.C. .
Stipendium, Max Planck Institut für europäische Rechtsgeschichte, Frankfurt am Main.
Guest researcher, Max Planck Institut für europäische Rechtsgeschichte, Frankfurt am Main.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Angelini P., L'influence du droit criminel byzantin dans le Code de Stéphan Dušan, International meeting of young legal historians, Thessaloniki, 30 September-1 October 2011.
Angelini P., The reception of Greek-roman law in Serbia. Between innovation and tradition, ACCA - (Over-) regulation versus flexibilization, Leuven, 4 May 2012.
Angelini P., L’influence du droit gréco-romain dans la codification d’Étienne Dušan, Journées internationales 2012 de la Société d'Histoire du Droit, Salzburg, 24-27 May 2012.

Angelini P., The Code of Dušan 1349-1354 and the influence of Byzantine law and culture in Serbian society in the 14th century, Scandinavia and the Balkans: Cultural interactions with Byzantium and Eastern Europe in the first Millennium, Sofia, 25-28 September 2012.
Angelini P., The judicial organization in Byzantine law, Recht en rechters in de Lage Landen, Tilburg, 13-14 December 2012.
Angelini P., The juridical protection of the Latins in the Code of Dušan 1349-1354, The Fairest Meadows in the World’: Crusades and Crusaders in the Balkans. Veliko Tarnovo, 7-9 November 2013.
Angelini P., The reception of Byzantine law among the Slavic populations: a comparative perspective, Cyril and Methodius: Byzantium and the World of the Slavs, Thessaloniki, 28-30 November 2013.
Angelini P., The repression of sexual crimes in Byzantine law and its reception among Slav populations, Framing premodern desires, Between Sexuality, Sin and Crime, Turku, 4-5 April 2014.
Angelini P., The use of the imperial title in the documents of the Slav monarchs (13th–14th century), The Emperor in the Byzantine World, 47th Byzantine Spring Symposium, Cardiff 25-27 April 2014.
Angelini P., Building the Imperial Legitimateness: The Serbian Case, International Medieval Congress, Leeds, 7-10 July 2014.
Angelini P., Translation and adoption of Greek-Roman law in the Slav-Byzantine empires, International Medieval Congress, Leeds, 6-9 July 2015.
Angelini P., Greek-roman law in Serbia: the Abridged syntagma of Blastares, 125 years since the birth of Alexander Vasilyevich Soloviev, Beograd, 18th-19th September 2015.

Angelini P. (2016), The Slavs and the Byzantine imperial ideology: the struggle for the power, Politics beyond the Emperor: structures, strategies and evolution of the powers behind the throne from Rome to Byzantium”, Bologna, 14th-15th April 2016.
Angelini P., The repression of heresies in the Syntagma of Blastares, XV International Congress of Medieval Canon Law, Paris, 17-23 July 2016.
Angelini P. , The crime of high treason in the Syntagma of Blastares, 23rd International Congress of Byzantine Studies, Belgrade, 22 - 27 August 2016.
Angelini P., The reception of Byzantine criminal law in Serbia through the Syntagma of Blastares, 23rd International Congress of Byzantine Studies, Belgrade, 22 - 27 August 2016.

Angelini P., The Byzantine juridical legacy in Bulgaria after the conversion to Christianity (The Zakon sudnyj ljudem – The court law for the people), Days of Justinian I, Skopje, 11-12 November 2016.

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Esperto internazionale del National Center for Educational Quality Enhancement of Georgia, Repubblica democratica di Georgia.

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: Scientific staff, nel progetto FWO (Fondo fiammingo per la ricerca) finanziato dal 1 febbraio 2013, Expertpanel Sciences of Law and Criminology (G&M1)FWO. Titolo progetto: Legal transplant of Greek-Roman Law through the Syntagma of Blastares.

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Dottorato di ricerca XXII° ciclo, "Identità culturali nell'area adriatica: dalla koinè tardo antica al diritto comune, Facoltà di Giurisprudenza, Università degli studi di Teramo. Titolo di Dottore di ricerca conseguito in data 08-01-2010.

Docente a contratto, corso di Storia del diritto. Corso di laurea Servizi giuridici per le imprese, Facoltà di Economia, Università degli studi "G. d'Annunzio" Chieti-Pescara (a.a. 2012-2013). Successivamente: Dipartimento di Scienze Giuridiche e Sociali (a.a. 2013-2014), Università degli studi "G. d'Annunzio" Chieti-Pescara
Docente a contratto, corso di Storia del diritto, Facoltà di Giurisprudenza, Università telematica "Leonardo da Vinci".
